metadata.synopsis: Male nurse Benigno (Javier Cámara) becomes infatuated with a complete stranger when he watches dancer Alicia (Leonor Watling) practicing from the anonymity of his apartment. After being injured in a car accident, Alicia is brought to a nearby hospital, where Benigno serendipitously happens to be her caregiver. When wounded bullfighter Lydia (Rosario Flores) is brought into the same ward, her companion, writer Marco (Darío Grandinetti), begins to bond with Benigno.

reviews: Talk to Her is all about making connections; how we interact with people and the reasons why we make the relationships that we do.
The film sways between different forms of love - from tender, unconditional affection to obsession and mania.
Unfortunately, the Spanish enfant terrible's iconoclastic artistic hysteria never rises to the surface in Talk to Her.
It earns its R rating but it is a thoughtful unique depiction of that line between love and obsession.
no other current director blends comedy and drama as smoothly or with as much flair
Humanity is intricate, contradictory, fathomless here, and the filmmaking just as rich.

Almodovar uses the characters' unlikely predicaments to show how we define ourselves by narration, but his story is so overdetermined that ultimately the two men seem as constrained as their brain-dead sweethearts.

Almodovar continues to refine the form of melodrama ... without sacrificing one iota of emotional texture or resonance.
